name: Suriname
description: Suriname, officially the Republic of Suriname, is a country in South America, bordered by Guyana to the west, French Guiana to the east, Brazil to the south and north, and the Atlantic Ocean to the northeast. It’s known for its incredible biodiversity, pristine rainforests, and unique Maroon culture. Suriname boasts a complex history shaped by indigenous populations, European colonization, and the legacy of slavery, resulting in a vibrant and diverse society.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The capital and largest city of Suriname, located on the Suriname River.
quickFacts.detail: Paramaribo is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, renowned for its Dutch colonial architecture and unique blend of cultures.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of Suriname is diverse, with significant Maroon, Creole, Javanese, and indigenous communities.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population speaks Sranan Tongo, a Creole language.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Suriname is the fifth-smallest country in South America.
quickFacts.detail: Approximately 90% of the country is covered by dense rainforest.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.value: Sranan Tongo, Dutch, English, and several indigenous languages
quickFacts.description: A multilingual nation with a rich linguistic heritage.
quickFacts.detail: Dutch is used in government and education.

quickFacts.label: Independence
quickFacts.description: Suriname gained independence from the Netherlands.
quickFacts.detail: Previously part of the Dutch Guiana colony.

climateData.title: Tropical Rainforest Climate
climateData.description: Suriname experiences a tropical rainforest climate, characterized by consistently high temperatures and humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant, with distinct wet and dry seasons.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season (June - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This season is marked by heavy rainfall, high humidity, and frequent thunderstorms. Rivers swell, and travel can be challenging.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season (December - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season brings lower rainfall, reduced humidity, and clearer skies. It's a popular time for tourism and outdoor activities.

naturalWonders.name: Central Suriname Nature Reserve
naturalWonders.description: The Central Suriname Nature Reserve is a vast, largely untouched area of primary rainforest, encompassing a significant portion of Suriname's biodiversity. It’s a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a critical habitat for numerous endangered species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This reserve is one of the largest protected areas in South America, covering over 1.6 million hectares. It’s characterized by towering trees, diverse wildlife, and pristine rivers.  The reserve is largely inaccessible by road, requiring river travel or hiking.

naturalWonders.name: Kanai Falls
naturalWonders.description: Kanai Falls is a spectacular series of waterfalls located in the interior of Suriname, offering a refreshing escape into the rainforest.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: These falls cascade down a series of rocky terraces, creating a stunning display of water and mist. The surrounding area is lush and teeming with wildlife.  Reaching the falls requires a challenging hike or river journey.

ecosystemData.title: Surinamese Rainforest Ecosystem
ecosystemData.overview: Suriname’s rainforest is one of the most biodiverse ecosystems on Earth, playing a crucial role in global carbon sequestration and climate regulation. It’s home to a vast array of plant and animal species, many of which are found nowhere else.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: Suriname is home to a diverse range of mammals, including jaguars, ocelots, tapirs, capybaras, and various monkey species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Suriname boasts an incredible variety of bird species, including macaws, parrots, toucans, and numerous migratory birds.

notableSpecies.name: Harpy Eagle
notableSpecies.significance: Top predator and symbol of the rainforest

notableSpecies.name: Hoatzin
notableSpecies.significance: Ancient bird with unique digestive system

biodiversityCategories.name: Reptiles & Amphibians
biodiversityCategories.description: Suriname’s rainforest is home to a diverse array of reptiles and amphibians, including caimans, snakes, frogs, and lizards.

notableSpecies.name: Green Anaconda
notableSpecies.significance: One of the largest snakes in the world

notableSpecies.name: Dendrobatidae (Poison Dart Frogs)
notableSpecies.significance: Unique skin secretions containing potent toxins

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Suriname
activities.description: Suriname offers a wide range of outdoor activities for adventure seekers and nature enthusiasts.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the rainforest on foot and discover hidden waterfalls and scenic viewpoints.

activities.name: Rio Centrale Hike
activities.description: Hike along the Rio Centrale, observing wildlife and enjoying the rainforest scenery.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, insect repellent, water

activities.name: Mount Kasikasima Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike to the summit of Mount Kasikasima, Suriname’s highest peak.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, trekking poles, water, food, navigation tools

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Experience the beauty of Suriname’s rivers and waterways through various water sports.

activities.name: River Cruises
activities.description: Relaxing cruises along the Suriname River and other waterways, offering opportunities for wildlife viewing.

activities.name: Canoeing
activities.description: Explore the smaller tributaries and waterways by canoe.

clothing.summer: Lightweight, breathable clothing, swimwear, hat, sunglasses
clothing.winter: Long-sleeved shirts, trousers, fleece jacket, waterproof jacket

equipment.basic: Backpack, water bottle, flashlight, first-aid kit

safety: Carry a satellite phone or personal locator beacon (PLB)
